item.title: Team17's Sintopia Lets You Manage Your Own Bureaucratic Hell
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/sintopia-team17-hell-manager

Developer Piraknights and publisher Team17 have announced Sintopia, a management sim in which you must oversee a nightmarishly bureaucratic vision of Hell.

In a press release, Team17 and Piraknights describe Sintopia as a "God simulation game", although "Satan simulation game" might be a more appropriate description. Rather uniquely, it promises an asymmetrical dual-world style of gameplay.

Your time will be split between the Overworld and Hell. In the Overworld, you'll watch as future Hell recruits "damn themselves by committing a host of sins", and then in Hell, you'll punish those souls and use them to fuel your empire.

The premise reminds me quite strongly of Red Tape, but rather than zooming in on a particular damned soul's journey through Hell, this is what it looks like when the camera is pulled back and the whole sordid business (literally) is on display.

This being a management sim, you will, of course, be able to shape and mold Hell to your darkest desires, building facilities and placing them wherever you want. After all, who's going to stop you?

You'll also have to watch out for your souls building up the sins they accumulate throughout their lives. Too much sin could result in what Piraknights calls a "demonic invasion", and that doesn't sound like something you'd want to deal with.

You can check out the debut trailer for Sintopia, which shows off the game's devilishly humorous take on the world below, right here.

It's also likely that Sintopia is inspired by the likes of 2003's Heaven and Hell, and it's got overtones of Dungeon Keeper and Evil Genius about it as well.

Sintopia is due to land on PC via Steam Early Access sometime next year. We don't have a more concrete release window for the game yet, unfortunately. Stay tuned for more.

item.title: Vanguard: Normandy Brings The WWII Board Game Experience To Kickstarter This November
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/tabletop/news/vanguard-normandy-brings-wwii-board-game-experience-to-kickstarter-this-november

Warlord Games has announced a new board game is coming to Kickstarter. The game, Vanguard: Normandy, is a historically inspired WWII board game built on the foundation of Warlord Games' acclaimed wargame, Bolt Action.

The Vanguard: Normandy Announcement

According to an official press release, Vanguard: Normandy focuses on the struggle between the US and German armies as they battle to hold Normandy in the Summer of 1944. 1-4 players can take control of the American or German armies and partake in multiplayer campaign missions inspired by historical accounts. The game will also include a full solo-play mode following the real battles of the US Army.

The game will use key mechanics from Bolt Action, including its Order Dice and Pinning rules. Players will capture objectives, navigate the fog of war, manage vital resources, gain different types of Requisition points, use them to deploy their forces.

No prior experience with Bolt Action is required. Vanguard: Normandy is a standalone board game experience. In fact, Warlord Games designed this game to lower obstacles for those interested in the hobby of wargaming.

Not everyone wants to assemble and paint miniatures before they play a game, so we're taking
those obstacles away for Vanguard: Normandy whilst creating a board game that still feels like
Bolt Action. By adapting the unit activation and pin mechanisms, the game will have a familiarity
to Bolt Action players - the rest of the game, however, is brand new!

A copy of Vanguard: Normandy will contain the following:

  • More than 50 pre-assembled and pre-painted US and German miniatures, including armored vehicles
  • 15 Double-sided interlocking hex boards
  • Fully detailed unit information cards
  • Full color rules, campaign books, and punchboards
  • A set of custom dice and wooden counters

The crowdfunding campaign for Vanguard: Normandy will go live on Kickstarter November 5. If you sign up to the game's mailing list before it goes live, you will receive an exclusive dice tray at no additional charge alongside the campaign's fulfillment.
